com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api
Class KmlLod

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.GESchemaObject
          com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.GEEventEmitter
              com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.KmlObject
                  com.nitrous.gwt.earth.client.api.KmlLod

public class KmlLod
extends KmlObject

The KmlLod or level of detail, describes the size of the projected region on the screen that is required in order for the region to be considered active. Also specifies the size of the pixel ramp used for fading in (from transparent to opaque) and fading out (from opaque to transparent).

Author:
Nick

getMinLodPixels

public final float getMinLodPixels()
Specifies measurement in screen pixels that represents the minimum limit of the visibility range for a given Region. Google Earth calculates the size of the region when projected onto screen space. Then it computes the square root of the region's area (if, for example, the Region is square and the viewpoint is directly above the Region, and the Region is not tilted, this measurement is equal to the width of the projected Region). If this measurement falls within the limits defined by minLodPixels and maxLodPixels (and if the LatLonAltBox is in view), the region is active. If this limit is not reached, the associated geometry is considered to be too far from the user's viewpoint to be drawn.

Returns:

setMinLodPixels

public final void setMinLodPixels(float minLodPixels)
Parameters:
minLodPixels - Specifies measurement in screen pixels that represents the minimum limit of the visibility range for a given Region. Google Earth calculates the size of the region when projected onto screen space. Then it computes the square root of the region's area (if, for example, the Region is square and the viewpoint is directly above the Region, and the Region is not tilted, this measurement is equal to the width of the projected Region). If this measurement falls within the limits defined by minLodPixels and maxLodPixels (and if the LatLonAltBox is in view), the region is active. If this limit is not reached, the associated geometry is considered to be too far from the user's viewpoint to be drawn.

getMaxLodPixels

public final float getMaxLodPixels()
Returns:
Measurement in screen pixels that represents the maximum limit of the visibility range for a given Region. A value of -1, the default, indicates "active to infinite size."

setMaxLodPixels

public final void setMaxLodPixels(float maxLodPixels)
Parameters:
maxLodPixels - Measurement in screen pixels that represents the maximum limit of the visibility range for a given Region. A value of -1, the default, indicates "active to infinite size."

getMinFadeExtent

public final float getMinFadeExtent()
Returns:
Distance over which the geometry fades, from fully opaque to fully transparent. This ramp value, expressed in screen pixels, is applied at the minimum end of the LOD (visibility) limits.

setMinFadeExtent

public final void setMinFadeExtent(float minFadeExtent)
Parameters:
minFadeExtent - Distance over which the geometry fades, from fully opaque to fully transparent. This ramp value, expressed in screen pixels, is applied at the minimum end of the LOD (visibility) limits.

getMaxFadeExtent

public final float getMaxFadeExtent()
Returns:
Distance over which the geometry fades, from fully transparent to fully opaque. This ramp value, expressed in screen pixels, is applied at the maximum end of the LOD (visibility) limits.

setMaxFadeExtent

public final void setMaxFadeExtent(float maxFadeExtent)
Parameters:
maxFadeExtent - Distance over which the geometry fades, from fully transparent to fully opaque. This ramp value, expressed in screen pixels, is applied at the maximum end of the LOD (visibility) limits.
